de.mrapp.android.adapter.decorator

Class AbstractDecorator

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.util.view.AbstractViewHolderAdapter
      • de.mrapp.android.adapter.decorator.AbstractDecorator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractExpandableListDecorator, AbstractListDecorator

    public abstract class AbstractDecorator
extends de.mrapp.android.util.view.AbstractViewHolderAdapter
    An abstract base class for all decorators, which should allow to customize the appearance of the view, which is used to visualize the items of an adapter. It provides methods, which allows to use the view holder pattern to reference views in order to gain a better performance.
    Since:
    0.1.0

    • Method Detail

      • adaptViewState

        protected final void adaptViewState(@NonNull
                                    android.view.View view,
                                    boolean enabled,
                                    boolean selected)
        Adapts the state of a view, which is used to visualize an item. This method should never be called or overridden by any custom decorator implementation.
        Parameters:
        view - The view, whose state should be adapted, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        enabled - True, if the item, which is visualized by the view, is currently enabled, false otherwise
        selected - True , if the item, which is visualized by the view, is currently selected, false otherwise

      • getView

        @Deprecated
protected final <ViewType extends android.view.View> ViewType getView(@IdRes
                                                                                  int viewId)
        Deprecated. Has been replaced by method findViewById
        Returns the view, which belongs to a specific resource ID by using the view holder pattern in order gain a better performance. The view will be implicitly casted to the type of the attribute it should be assigned to.
        Type Parameters:
        ViewType - The type, the view is implicitly casted to. It must inherited from the class View
        Parameters:
        viewId - The resource ID of the view, which should be returned, as an Integer value. The ID must be a valid resource ID of a view, which belongs to the view, whose appearance is currently customized by the decorator
        Returns:
        The view, which belongs to the given resource ID, as an instance of the class View or null, if no view with the given ID is available

      • isViewStateAdapted

        protected boolean isViewStateAdapted()
        Returns, whether the state of a view, which is used to visualize an item of the adapter, should be adapted to the item's state, or not. For example, if the item is disabled, the according view will also be disabled by the decorator by automatically calling its setEnabled(boolean):void method. This method may overridden by a custom decorator implementation to adapt the behavior of the decorator.
        Returns:
        True, if the state of a view, which is used to visualized an item of the adapter, should be adapted to the item's state, false otherwise

      • areChildrenViewStatesAdapted

        protected boolean areChildrenViewStatesAdapted()
        Returns, whether the state of the children of a view, which is used to visualize an item of the adapter, should be adapted to the item's state, or not. For example, if the item is disabled, the according view will also be disabled by the decorator by automatically calling its setEnabled(boolean):void method. The states of children are only adapted, if the method isViewStateAdapter returns true as well. This method may overridden by a custom decorator implementation to adapt the behavior of the decorator.
        Returns:
        True, if the state of the children of a view, which is used to visualize an item of the adapter, should be adapter to the item's state, false otherwise
